title: PM Modi arrives in Canada for G7 Summit
content: Prime Minister Modi will also hold several bilateral meetings on the sidelines of the Summit, coming over a month after India's Operation Sindoor that had targeted terror infrastructure in Pakistan and Pakistan-occupied Kashmir in retaliation for the April 22 Pahalgam attacks.

title: Indians turning to Artificial Intelligence for news, influencers find big audience: report
content: The Reuters Institute for the Study of Journalism‚Äôs annual Digital News Report finds that Indians prefer video content for news, and rely on generative AI for summarising and personalising news

title: Minor landslides reported in Kasaragod; river breaches bank in Kannur

title: Delhi-bound Air India flight returns to Hong Kong after snag
content: Air India flight AI 315 safely returns to Hong Kong due to technical issue, passengers assisted, aircraft under inspection

title: Seeman shoots election salvo from palm tree; says govt. should remove ban on toddy
content: When we come to power, we will ban foreign liquor except in select places, says the NTK chief; Toddy is not banned in other States because their Chief Ministers are not connected to liquor manufacturers, he adds

title: T.N. Forest Department deputes mahouts and cavadies to Thailand for elephant care training
content: A team of 18 members will be deputed from June 17 to June 21; the delegation includes four mahouts, 11 cavadies, a forest range officer, and a forest veterinary assistant surgeon

title: IIT Madras launches course in machine learning operations
content: The online 110-hour certification MLOps course, jointly offered with TCS iON, aims to prepare professionals for careers in AI, ML and to address the demand for talent in the evolving domain of machine learning operations

content: Tamil Nadu Domestic Workers Welfare Trust submitted a petition to the State govt. to extend the Sexual Harassment of Women at Workplace (Prevention, Prohibition and Redressal) Act to domestic workers, among other demands

title: Footpath along Taluk Office Road revamped with lights, fountains
content: The Highways Department beautified the 300-m-long stretch adjacent to its campus in Saidapet. It now has seating arrangements and grass beds

title: Classes at newly sanctioned Jawahar Navodaya Vidyalayas to commence from July 14
content: Seven JNVs coming up in Bhadradri Kothagudem, Jagtial, Mahabubnagar, Medchal-Malkajgiri, Nizamabad, Sangareddy and Suryapet districts

title: Government scheme helps boy from Virudhunagar get admission to NIT Rourkela
content: The boy was selected under the Naan Mudhalvan scheme, implemented by Virudhunagar district administration, and was provided with coaching and reading materials to clear JEE Mains

content: The standard operating procedure issued clarifies that only a higher authority than the sealing officer can unseal a property

title: SCR set to shrink in scope as South Coast Railway gains steam
content: Newly-carved zone likely to become operational in 3 months; gazette notification to be issued after revised detailed project report, currently under review by Railway Board, is submitted

title: Telangana Intermediate Supplementary results announced; about 1.23 lakh first-year students show improvement
content: A total of 4,13,880 students, for both general and vocational stream, appeared in the Supplementary exams conducted at 892 centres

title: DRDO and IIT-Delhi demonstrate free-space quantum secure communication over one-km distance
content: Considered a major breakthrough in the field of cybersecurity, the use of quantum entanglement is being described as a landmark achievement in the new quantum era of secure communication

title: New flowering plant species discovered in Aravali hills landscape near Jaipur
content: The plant was first spotted by researcher Nishant Chauhan, a committee member of the Satpura Biodiversity Conservation Society, who noticed a unique Portulaca-like succulent growing from the rock crevice on the dry and rocky hill slopes near the historic Galtaji temple on the outskirts of Jaipur

title: India to export 150 locomotives to Africa worth over ‚Çπ3,000 crore
content: The 4,500-HP locomotives are equipped with air-conditioned driver‚Äôs compartment, regenerative braking, microprocessor-based controls, and modular architecture

title: Government sent the right message to world through Operation Sindoor, says Vice-President
content: People have to believe in nationalism and the political class must remain united on all national issues, Vice-President Jagdeep Dhankhar said at a programme held at Jipmer in Puducherry

title: India will never forgive Lalu Prasad for insulting Ambedkar, says Chouhan
content: Union Minister Shivraj Singh Chouhan said that RJD chief Lalu Prasad has ‚Äúinsulted‚Äù B.R. Ambedkar; Ministers Arjun Ram Meghwal and Bhupender Yadav demanded an apology from Mr. Prasad

title: Arkansas' Wood throws 1st MCWS no-no since '60
content: Arkansas' Gage Wood pitched the third no-hitter in College World Series history and first in 65 years on Monday, striking out a record 19 Murray State batters in a 3-0 victory.

title: Ex-Ohtani interpreter reports to federal prison
content: Ippei Mizuhara, the disgraced former interpreter for Los Angeles Dodgers superstar Shohei Ohtani, is in federal prison in Pennsylvania, a spokesperson for the Federal Bureau of Prisons told ESPN on Monday.

title: Fulmer's grandson commits to Vols' class of '27
content: Linebacker prospect JP Peace, grandson of national champion head coach and former Vols athletic director Phillip Fulmer, announced his commitment to the Tennessee program on Monday.

title: Judge, Ohtani lapping field in All-Star voting
content: Aaron Judge, the slugger who leads the majors in batting average, and Shohei Ohtani, who have combined to win five of the past eight Most Valuable Player awards, are lapping the rest of Major League Baseball in the first batch of All-Star Game balloting.

title: Aces' Wilson still in protocol, out for Lynx game
content: Aces star A'ja Wilson will miss her third consecutive game in the concussion protocol Tuesday night at Minnesota.

title: U.S. hockey names first 6 players for '26 Olympics
content: The U.S. named Matthew and Brady Tkachuk, Auston Matthews, Jack Eichel, Quinn Hughes and Charlie McAvoy as its first six players for the 2026 Olympics, avoiding goaltenders on the initial roster unveiled Monday.

title: Chelsea beats LAFC at Club WC as Delap debuts
content: Pedro Neto and Enzo Fern√°ndez each scored goals to propel Chelsea to a 2-0 victory over LAFC in the Group D opener for each team in the Club World Cup in Atlanta on Monday afternoon.

title: Chestnut returning to Nathan's hot dog contest
content: Joey Chestnut, competitive eating legend, announced Monday that he is returning to the Nathan's Famous Hot Dog Eating Contest after a one-year hiatus from the annual Fourth of July event.

title: üèÄ How Bane trade will impact NBA offseason
content: Sunday's shocking deal has ramifications far beyond Orlando and Memphis -- including the Kevin Durant trade saga.

title: Padres-Dodgers ticket prices see major surge with Shohei Ohtani returning to the mound

content: The Red Sox stunned the baseball world Sunday, trading their $313.5 million All-Star to San Francisco.

title: How J.J. Spaun battled Oakmont, rain and bad breaks for a U.S. Open title
content: Oakmont was almost unplayable Sunday afternoon in the rain. But in the end, it was exactly what Spaun needed to become one of the unlikeliest U.S. Open champions.

content: Florida leads Edmonton 3-2 heading home for the next game. Here's how it happened, and what to watch for.

content: For five months, the Aloys have been making noise in Arkansas. Now their talent and journey is on full display.

content: Chelsea were ultimately too much for LAFC to handle in the teams' Club World Cup opener, but will they find similar success vs. stiffer competition?

title: Are Real Madrid ready to begin the Xabi Alonso era at the Club World Cup?
content: Xabi Alonso needs to hit the ground running at Real Madrid, with the Club World Cup starting just three weeks after he was hired as coach.

content: Four people have been sentenced to between 14 and 22 months in prison for hate crimes and threats committed against Vin√≠cius J√∫nior before a Copa del Rey tie between Real Madrid and Atl√©tico Madrid in January 2023.

title: 'It's impossible': Hot temps worry CWC players
content: Players and coaches competing at the Club World Cup have expressed concerns about the hot and humid conditions during the tournament.

title: USMNT ends skid, nets 5 in Gold Cup opening win
content: Malik Tillman scored twice as the United States built a three-goal, first-half lead and ended a four-game losing streak by routing Trinidad and Tobago 5-0 on Sunday in a Concacaf Gold Cup opener.

title: Reijnders: Pressure is on to win trophies at City
content: Tijjani Reijnders has said he is already feeling the pressure to win trophies following his move from AC Milan.

title: Lloris: Spurs must build on Europa League win
content: Hugo Lloris believes his former club Tottenham have lifted a weight off their shoulders after winning the Europa League, and must build on from it.

title: Delap challenged to earn No. 9 after Chelsea move
content: Enzo Maresca believes Liam Delap has the potential to become England's main striker, but warned the 22-year-old he faces a fight to get into the Chelsea line-up first.

title: Sevilla hire ex-Quakes coach Almeyda as manager
content: Sevilla have appointed Argentine Matias Almeyda as manager, the LaLiga club said on Monday, with their former player signing a three-year contract at the side which battled relegation last season.

title: Source: Bale joins group eyeing Plymouth sale
content: Former Real Madrid winger and Wales international Gareth Bale is involved with a United States private equity company discussing a potential takeover at Plymouth Argyle, a source has told ESPN.

title: USMNT eases pressure with big win to open Gold Cup, but tougher tests ahead
content: Sunday's big win should relieve some pressure on a U.S. team that's been struggling for form and harmony of late. However, it's clear bigger tests are ahead at this Gold Cup and beyond.

content: The special threads will be worn during Gatorade Workout Day and the Derby the day before the All-Star Game.

title: Texas State, cryptic posts and the Pac-12's next move
content: Texas State looms as the favorite to join the Pac-12. Why could that happen? What would come next? And what about Memphis?

title: Don't be surprised if ... these 19 things happen in 2025
content: In fantasy, you don't draft last year's stats, which is why it's important to be forward-thinking. Eric Karabell offers his thoughts on players who could delight or disappoint in 2025.

content: Sunday's Canadian GP was the first podium in 2025 that didn't feature a McLaren. Is the tide about to turn on F1's runaway leader?

content: Nyara Sabally and Kiah Stokes could be on the rise in fantasy leagues with increased opportunity ahead in the wake of injuries.

content: When the Current are firing on all cylinders, there's no stopping them. That and more in our latest rankings.

content: Chelsea will reportedly look to sign Lyon's Malick Fofana. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Advocates‚Äô body issues statement against ED notice to senior advocate Arvind Datar
content: Even though the summons against Arvind Datar has since been withdrawn, the association said it registers its strong protest against the move

title: Day after chopper crash, Uttarakhand government to resume helicopter services from June 17
content: Uttarakhand Civil Aviation Development Authority CEO Sonika announces the resumption and adds that services will only run if the weather conditions will be favourable; Directorate General of Civil Aviation (DGCA) is going to keep a close watch on all shuttle services

title: India starts relocating citizens from Tehran¬†to other parts of Iran, considers exit routes from Israel for Indian citizens
content: As conflict escalates, EAM Jaishankar speaks to counterparts in Armenia and UAE; Indian embassy in Tehran working with local Iranian authorities to shift Indian citizens in the capital and other places to safer locations; in Israel, where the airspace is closed completely, Indian embassy officials in Tel Aviv are guiding citizens who can move out towards the land borders with Jordan and Egypt

title: Congress ‚Äòdeceives‚Äô OBCs, treats them only as vote bank, says BJP
content: The decision to conduct a fresh caste survey in Karnataka was driven by the motive of ‚Äòelectoral engineering‚Äô, says Union Minister Bhupender Yadav

title: RJD accuses ruling JD(U) of ‚Äònepotism‚Äô in Supreme Court panel counsel appointment
content: Senior RJD MP Manoj Jha says Janata Dal (United) national working president Sanjay Kumar Jha‚Äôs two daughters were made Group A panel counsel of the Union government in the Supreme Court without any necessary experience

title: Ban on use of drones near Kochi airport
content: The district administration has banned the operation of microlight aircraft, aero models, paragliders, Unmanned Aircraft Systems, powered hang gliders, laser beams, and hot-air balloons within a five-kilometre radius of the airport

title: Congress MLAs‚Äô PIL plea over Khajaguda land: HC directs them to submit representation afresh to government
content: Part of the construction was in the full tank level of the Khajaguda Lake, the petitioners told the Bench

title: UAE-based entrepreneur pledges ‚Çπ6 crore to families of medical students killed in Air India crash
content: Dr. Vayalil, founder and chairman of VPS Healthcare, a multinational healthcare group, described Manav, Aaryan, Rakesh, and Jaiprakash as ‚Äúfuture frontline heroes‚Äù

title: Surgical Gastro dept. at Thiruvananthapuram MCH celebrates golden jubilee
content: Department of Surgical Gastroenterology is the very first department to be established in a medical college to deal exclusively with complex gastrointestinal (GI) conditions needing surgical treatment in the country

title: Stranded Kashmiri students being shifted out of Iran‚Äôs capital Tehran to safer areas, say parents
content: A J&K Students Association spokesperson says students of Tehran University of Medical Sciences, Islamic Azad University and Iran University of Medical Sciences were successfully relocated; an estimate suggested 600 students from Kashmir were shifted to safer locations in Qom

title: Four women killed, several injured in firecracker factory explosion in Amroha
content: Blast in Atrasi village brings down entire structure; U.P. CM directs officials to expedite relief efforts

title: Don‚Äôt depend on agents for PF services, EPFO tells members
content: It says several cybercafe operators and fintech companies are charging EPFO members large sums of money for services that are officially free

title: Indore Congress councillor booked after accused in rape cases allege role in religious conversion
content: Anwar Qadri named in FIRs following claims by two arrested men; Congress terms case a political conspiracy

title: Rains: call to extend Plus One admission by a day
content: AHSTA seeks an extension on admissions, which was to be held on Monday and Tuesday, in the wake of rain fury in the State

title: Restoration of Mullassery Canal in progress, HC told
content: The court observed that it was pleased to hear the inundation of the city had been under control over the past two days despite heavy rain

title: Union govt. urged to increase support to States for skilling initiatives
content: Kerala Minister articulates State‚Äôs commitment to advancing the national skilling agenda while calling for greater cooperative federalism and equitable central support

content: The meeting did not decide on extension of SoO pact with the groups; SoO representative says they also proposed certain plans involving the security forces

title: VSDP protests with bodies in front of bank in Thiruvananthapuram
content: They accuse the bank of pushing the couple by demanding repayment of a loan the couple had availed several years ago

title: Debunking the 'Man United tax' myth
content: Transfer chiefs have complained for years, but it's on the club to stop paying over the odds for players.

title: An 11-year NBA veteran and the emergency transplant that saved his life
content: Sixteen months ago, Scot Pollard was in active heart failure, about to die. Then came a lifesaving transplant, uniting two families -- and two fathers -- forever. Watch E60's "Heart of Pearl" at 1 p.m. ET on ESPN.

title: EC to go for 100% webcasting of polling stations for closer monitoring of voting procedure
content: Bihar Assembly elections are due later this year and it will be the first state where 100% webcasting will be implemented.

title: Thrissur reels under heavy rain
content: Flooding, storm, power disruption leave coastal belt struggling. Wind uproots trees and damages power lines in several areas, resulting in prolonged power outages.

title: KMRL enters eighth year with expansion plans on track
content: Elevated tramway from High Court to Thevara among major projects proposed by Kochi Metro Rail Limited; feasibility study under way to introduce Water Metro in 21 locations across India

title: Formula-E Case: KTR questioned for eight hours by ACB
content: Security around Road No. 12, Banjara Hills, was heightened from early morning and the road leading to ACB office was barricaded

title: 'Immediately evacuate Tehran': Trump issues big warning to Iran; to leave G7 summit early
content: US President Trump issued a stark warning to Tehran, urging immediate evacuation amid escalating tensions and potential nuclear concerns. This followed reports of an Israeli airstrike on Iran's state broadcaster and significant damage to a major uranium enrichment facility. While Iran seeks US intervention, Trump hints at a potential diplomatic deal post-G7 summit, diverging from other leaders' calls for de-escalation.

title: Israel-Iran conflict: India starts evacuating students from Iran
content: Amid escalating Israel-Iran air strikes, the Indian government is relocating Indian students within Iran for their safety. Approximately 600 students have been moved to Qom from Tehran, a target of Israeli strikes, while 110 students from Urmia are near the Armenian border, awaiting evacuation. External Affairs Minister Jaishankar is actively engaged with regional counterparts to address the situation.

title: How China dodges the US chip ban: Flying suitcases, renting servers abroad, and ....
content: To circumvent US AI chip restrictions, Chinese firms are creatively processing data abroad, exemplified by engineers transporting hard drives to Malaysian data centers for AI model training. Southeast Asia is becoming a strategic hub with rapidly expanding data-center capacity, while the Middle East also attracts Chinese AI developers, highlighting the challenges of enforcing US export controls.

title: PM Modi to address G7 outreach session today
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi arrived in Calgary for the G7 Summit, marking his first visit to Canada since 2015. He will address the G7 Outreach Session and hold bilateral meetings, potentially including discussions with Canadian PM Mark Carney and Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky.

title: Joblessness rate rises to 5.6% in May from 5.1% in April: PLFS
content: India's unemployment rate edged up to 5.6% in May, a rise from 5.1% in April, as revealed by the Periodic Labour Force Survey. Simultaneously, the labor force participation rate experienced a dip, signaling tightening conditions in the job market.

title: Watch: Anchor runs for life as Israel bombs Iran State TV; studio turns to dust
content: Tensions escalate as Israel bombs Iranian state news amid ongoing hostilities. A video shows a news presenter fleeing as an explosion rocks the studio. Despite the attack, Iran's broadcasting service resumed coverage, vowing resilience. This follows a fresh wave of Iranian missile strikes on Israel, resulting in casualties and heightened fears of a wider regional conflict.

title: Jobs in AI era: LinkedIn founder to Gen Z graduates; You will become 'enormously attractive' if...
content: LinkedIn co-founder Reid Hoffman encourages young people to embrace AI as a tool for job hunting, viewing them as "AI natives" who can help older professionals adapt.

title: Poll-day webcasting now at all polling booths to help EC monitor procedures
content: The Election Commission has mandated webcasting across all polling stations with internet connectivity to monitor procedures and prevent poll process violations. In areas lacking internet, alternative arrangements like videography will be implemented. Monitoring control rooms will be established at various levels, overseen by nodal officers, to ensure live observation and prompt action on any suspicious activity.

title: College student raped by 10 on Odisha beach
content: In a shocking incident in Odisha's Ganjam, a 20-year-old college student was allegedly gang-raped on a beach by a group of ten men. The assault occurred after the perpetrators attacked her male friend who was accompanying her.

title: Census process officially kicksoff, NPR unlikely to be updated
content: India's Census process, delayed by the pandemic, is set to resume in 2027, prioritizing a digital approach. The exercise will occur in two phases, starting with housing listing in 2026, followed by population enumeration in 2027.

title: GitHub CEO to startups: Your companies would struggle without developers as‚Ä¶
content: GitHub CEO Thomas Dohmke cautioned startup founders that while AI coding assistants facilitate initial launches, scaling requires human developers and technical expertise. He highlighted that AI-built startups often lack the complex systems needed to attract significant investment. Dohmke stressed the importance of coding skills and knowing when to leverage AI versus relying on personal abilities for efficient development.

title: Covid-19: With 11 deaths, current wave toll in country past 100-mark
content: India's Covid-19 death toll has surpassed 100, with 11 deaths reported on Monday, the highest single-day increase in the current wave. Kerala accounts for the majority of fatalities, with victims having pre-existing conditions. While new sub-variants are suspected to be driving the surge, experts say symptoms remain mild, and most cases are managed at home with symptomatic treatment.

title: ‚ÄòHousefull 5‚Äô BO collection: Akshay Kumar's film inches closer to Rs 160 cr mark
content: Housefull 5 is a box office success. The comedy film stars Akshay Kumar, Abhishek Bachchan, and Riteish Deshmukh. It has earned close to Rs 160 crore. The movie was released on June 6, 2025. The film maintains strong collections. The movie features a star-studded cast. It includes Sanjay Dutt, Jackie Shroff and others. The film attracts audiences to cinema halls.

title: Bike taxi captain & woman attack each other in Bengaluru, cops arrest the man
content: In Bengaluru, a Rapido bike taxi captain named Suman was arrested after allegedly slapping a female rider, Priya, who criticized his reckless driving. Priya claimed Suman drove rashly and refused to follow the designated route, leading to an argument when she ended the ride early.

title: Taylor Swift & Travis Kelce's love inspires cheetah cubs named after them, fans swoon
content: Two orphaned cheetah cubs, Taylor and Travis, are rescued from illegal wildlife trade. They now thrive at a conservation center in Somaliland. The cubs have formed a strong bond. Staff at the center named them after Taylor Swift and Travis Kelce. The cheetahs are inseparable, often grooming and napping together. Their story highlights unexpected friendships and enduring love.

title: JJ Peterka trade buzz grows: Sabres open to offers amid sign-and-trade talks
content: Buffalo Sabres are considering trading JJ Peterka. The young winger's impressive performance has attracted attention from other teams. General Manager Kevyn Adams is evaluating potential offers. Contract negotiations could lead to a trade. Peterka's departure could reshape the Sabres' roster. A sign-and-trade deal might bring valuable assets. The team aims for a more aggressive overhaul.

title: Hope to conclude EU FTA by year-end: PM Modi
content: PM Modi has reaffirmed India's commitment to finalize a free trade agreement with the European Union by the end of the year, highlighting the potential benefits for all stakeholders. Discussions have accelerated, with the next negotiation round scheduled for July 7. Furthermore, the India Middle-East Europe Economic Corridor, though delayed, is expected to foster regional peace and prosperity.

title: Man who dodged AI 171 crash boards AI 159 with prayers
content: The first Ahmedabad to London Gatwick flight since the Dreamliner crash took off with a mix of apprehension and faith. Passengers, including one who narrowly avoided the previous flight, expressed nervousness and trust in Air India.

title: SC: No shield for a man who didn't report unaccounted money in account for months
content: The Supreme Court denied anticipatory bail to a Bihar man who delayed reporting a suspicious ‚Çπ20 lakh deposit in his account for four months. Delhi police summoned him for cyber fraud after the money, linked to a crime, appeared in his account. He claimed his tenant misused his account details obtained under the pretext of online loan transfer.

title: Supreme Court lawyer body slams ED notice to senior advocate
content: The Supreme Court Advocates on Record Association (SCAORA) has strongly condemned the Enforcement Directorate's (ED) notice to senior advocate Arvind Datar regarding his legal opinion on employee stock options granted to Rashmi Saluja.

title: China adding 100 nuclear warheads annually: SIPRI
content: China is rapidly expanding its nuclear arsenal, adding 100 warheads annually and surpassing India's stockpile significantly. While India maintains a slight lead over Pakistan, recent military tensions risked nuclear escalation. Both nations are developing advanced delivery systems, including multiple warhead capabilities, heightening concerns about regional stability and the potential for catastrophic miscalculation.

title: 'Cyber Suraksha': Armed forces launch cybersecurity drill
content: Amid escalating cyber threats from China and Pakistan, the armed forces have initiated a 12-day 'Cyber Suraksha' exercise. Organized by the Defence Cyber Agency, the multi-phase program aims to enhance national-level cyber resilience. Over 100 participants are involved in simulated real-world scenarios, reinforcing secure practices and testing cyber skills to cultivate a security-first culture.

title: Travis Kelce‚Äôs weight loss stirs drama: fans speculate Swift‚Äôs influence
content: Travis Kelce's offseason transformation, including a reported 25-pound weight loss, has sparked fan discussions, with some attributing it to his relationship with Taylor Swift. NFL insider Jeremy Fowler highlighted Kelce's commitment to slimming down after playing heavier last season. While some fans speculate about Swift's influence, others commend Kelce's dedication to peak performance for the upcoming season.

title: FATF slams Pahalgam attack: 'Couldn't happen without funds'
content: The Financial Action Task Force (FATF) has strongly condemned the recent terrorist attack in Pahalgam, highlighting the crucial role of financial support in enabling such acts. FATF's statement coincides with India's appeal for action against Pakistan's alleged support for terrorist activities. The agency emphasized the need for global unity and enhanced counter-terrorism financing measures to dismantle terror networks effectively.

title: Watch: Thousands of Iranians try to flee Israeli attacks; cause massive traffic jams
content: Fear grips Iran, especially Tehran, as Israel threatens further strikes, prompting mass exodus towards the Caspian Sea. Airstrike warnings trigger panic, revealing Tehran's inadequate shelter infrastructure. While daily life persists amidst fuel rationing and cash withdrawal limits, cities beyond Tehran also show signs of distress, with residents stocking up on essentials and fleeing to rural areas.

title: India backs Cyprus in its fight against Turkiye
content: Amidst escalating tensions between Israel and Iran, PM Modi, during his Cyprus visit, advocated for dialogue and stability. He emphasized that this is not an era of war, echoing concerns about conflicts in West Asia and Europe. Modi reaffirmed India's support for Cyprus's sovereignty and unity, addressing the Cyprus Question based on UN resolutions.

title: India not a signatory, UNHCR card not valid here, says court
content: A Thane court sentenced eight Rohingya Muslims to two years imprisonment and a fine for illegally entering and residing in India without valid documents. The court ordered their deportation to Myanmar after their sentence, emphasizing that UNHCR cards don't grant residency rights in India.

title: '5 wickets in 5 balls': Digvesh Rathi does it again; Sanjiv Goenka can't keep calm
content: Digvesh Rathi, the mystery spinner who rose to prominence with Lucknow Super Giants in IPL 2025, continues to impress. A video surfaced showing Rathi achieving a remarkable feat in a local T20 match, claiming five wickets in five balls. His impressive performance, featuring deceptive googlies, further solidifies his reputation as a talent to watch.

title: Tamil Nadu: Daily-wagers' girl dwarfs the odds, engineers path to IIT-Bombay
content: Yogeshwari, a girl from rural Tamil Nadu with dwarfism, is set to study aerospace engineering at IIT-Bombay. Coming from a humble background where her mother works as a daily wage labourer, Yogeshwari discovered her passion for science and aerospace engineering through government schemes. Despite initial challenges with JEE-Advanced, she cleared it with her teachers' support.

title: Tamil Nadu: On HC order, cops arrest ADGP-rank officer in kidnapping case
content: In a dramatic turn of events, ADGP H M Jayaram was arrested on Madras HC orders for allegedly abducting a minor in an inter-caste marriage case. Justice P Velmurugan directed the arrest based on confessions from other accused. MLA Poovai Jagan Moorthy, also implicated, was instructed to cooperate with the investigation, highlighting the court's stance against public servants aiding crimes.

title: Opening of Galwan Valley for tourists on 5th anniv of India-China troops clash delayed
content: Plans to open Galwan Valley hot springs for tourists on the fifth anniversary of the deadly clash have been delayed due to incomplete war memorial construction. The Ladakh administration and the Indian Army are collaborating to build supporting infrastructure in the area. Permit regulations are being amended to ease visitor access, with the opening expected soon after the memorial's completion.

title: IND vs ENG: 'Don‚Äôt think he‚Äôs realised ... ' - Karthik‚Äôs bold take on Shubman Gill's captaincy
content: Dinesh Karthik has cautioned Shubman Gill about the enormity of captaining India in the upcoming Test series against England, highlighting the vulnerability of the English bowling attack. Despite the challenges, Karthik remains hopeful about India's chances, despite the pressure England's batting will exert. The series, commencing on June 20 in Leeds, marks the start of a new WTC cycle.

title: 'Broke down and hugged': Dipika Kakar opens up about her liver cancer diagnosis
content: Dipika Kakar, recovering from a 14-hour surgery for stage two liver cancer, shared her emotional journey in a recent vlog. She discussed the challenges of being separated from her son, Ruhaan, and the fears she faced upon diagnosis.

title: J&K: NC ups ante against ‚Äòdual power centre‚Äô; seeks restoration of statehood
content: The National Conference (NC) has intensified its criticism of the "dual power centre" in Jammu and Kashmir, asserting it impedes effective governance. NC questions LG Manoj Sinha's claim of controlling only the police, arguing his authority over law, order, and IAS officer transfers undermines the elected government's functioning. Opposition parties are blaming Omar Abdullah govt for ineffective and lacklustre administration.

title: Trump declares war on 'millions upon millions' illegal immigrants in US cities
content: President Trump declared war on America's largest cities, ordering mass deportations of illegal immigrants he accuses Democrats of using for electoral gain. This came after downplaying US involvement in the Israel-Iran conflict. Trump's move exacerbates divisions, pitting urban versus rural America while immigration activists decry the deportation plan as based on inflated figures and demonization.

title: NHL trade rumor: Penguins drop Malkin bombshell; signs point to final chapter in Pittsburgh
content: A new NHL trade rumor points to the end of an era as the Pittsburgh Penguins are reportedly set to move on from star forward Evgeni Malkin. With one year left on his contract, sources say the franchise is not expected to offer him a new deal, hinting at a dramatic close to his storied career in Pittsburgh.

title: 'I‚Äôm trying to literally kill him': Maxx Crosby‚Äôs warning to Patrick Mahomes
content: Las Vegas Raiders' Maxx Crosby issued a stark warning to Kansas City Chiefs' Patrick Mahomes, expressing his intense desire to disrupt Mahomes' dominance. Crosby, fresh off signing a $106.5 million contract, aims to translate his aggressive playing style into tangible results against their division rival. With the Chiefs having consistently outperformed the Raiders, Crosby is determined to reverse their fortunes.

title: Bigger Indus plan: 113km canal to take surplus to Punjab, Haryana and Rajasthan
content: India is advancing its Indus water strategy by initiating a feasibility study for a 113 km canal to transfer surplus water from Jammu & Kashmir to Punjab, Haryana, and Rajasthan. This project aims to fully utilize the eastern rivers and India's allocated share in the western rivers, potentially reducing water flow to Pakistan.

title: 'Earlier, I used to beat Indians at will': What global chess stars say about India's dominance
content: Gukesh Dommaraju's rise to world chess champion at 18 has sparked a chess revolution, validating Garry Kasparov's prediction. At the Delhi International Open, seasoned players like GM Tornike Sanikidze noted the fierce competition from India's young talents. Veteran Rani Hamid acknowledged India's significant progress in chess. India is now a dominant force, driven by ambitious young players.

title: How an escalating Iran-Israel conflict can threaten India‚Äôs growth story
content: India's robust economic growth faces threats from escalating tensions in West Asia, particularly the Iran-Israel conflict, which could spike oil prices and disrupt trade routes. While India possesses sufficient energy reserves, potential disruptions could elevate inflation and shipping expenses. Government officials are closely monitoring the situation, confident that India's strong macroeconomic indicators will help it weather the crisis.

title: "Drones-Filled Skies, Every Minute Getting Worse": Indian Students In Tehran
content: As tensions continue to rise in West Asia, Indian students in Tehran recalled the initial hours of the conflict between Israel and Iran.

title: "Go Back To Your Country," Bengaluru Driver Told Woman Before Slapping Her
content: A video showing a Rapido bike taxi driver assaulting a woman passenger in Bengaluru's Jayanagar has gone viral on social media.

title: France's Macron Says Trump Has Made Offer For Israel-Iran Ceasefire
content: French President Emmanuel Macron said on Monday that U.S. President Donald Trump had made an offer for a ceasefire between Israel and Iran.

title: Trump To Cut Short G7 Summit Due To Middle East Situation
content: -U.S. President Donald Trump will return to Washington from the G7 summit in Canada on Monday night to attend to many "important matters," White House Press Secretary Karoline Leavitt said.

title: Colombian Presidential Candidate In "Critical" Condition After Shooting: Doctors
content: Colombian presidential candidate Miguel Uribe, who was shot in the head while campaigning in Bogota earlier this month, was in an "extremely critical" condition, doctors warned Monday.

title: "Everyone Should Immediately Evacuate Tehran", Says Trump Amid Fierce Fighting
content: President Donald Trump on Monday urged everyone to immediately evacuate Tehran, and reiterated that Iran should have signed a nuclear deal with the United States.

title: 4 Boys Killed After Speeding Truck Overturns, Crushes Them In UP: Cops
content: Four boys died in a road accident in Uttar Pradesh's Sitapur district after a speeding truck overturned and crushed them, police said on Monday.

title: "Carry It To Freedom": Netanyahu Urges Iranians To Stand Against "Radical Tyranny"
content: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu on Monday issued a direct plea for the "good people of Iran" to stand against Tehran's "radical tyranny", saying that "a light has been lit, carry it to freedom".

title: US Says It Is Deploying More Defensive Capabilities To Middle East
content: U.S. Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth said on Monday he had ordered the deployment of additional defensive capabilities to the Middle East, as the escalating conflict between Israel and Iran drives regional tensions higher.

title: Trump Predicts Iran Will Sign Nuclear Deal As War Intensifies
content: U.S. President Donald Trump said on Monday Iran should have signed a deal with the United States on its nuclear program before Israeli strikes began and that he believes they now want to make an agreement.

title: Israel's Haifa Refinery Facilities Shut Down After Iranian Attack
content: Israel's Haifa-based Bazan Group said all refinery facilities have been shut down after a power station used to produce steam and electricity were significantly damaged in an attack by Iran, according to a regulatory filing on Monday.

title: US Court Extends Pause On Trump Bid To Block Harvard Foreign Students
content: A judge on Monday extended a restraining order pausing Donald Trump's ban on Harvard bringing in and hosting foreign students as part of the US president's escalating campaign against the elite university.

title: Astronomers Locate Universe's 'Missing' Matter
content: With the help of powerful bursts of radio waves emanating from 69 locations in the cosmos, researchers now have found the "missing" matter.

title: UN Slashes Global Aid Plan Over 'Deepest Funding Cuts Ever'
content: The United Nations said that it was drastically scaling back its global humanitarian aid plans due to the "deepest funding cuts ever" -- leaving tens of millions of people facing dire straits.

title: Gaza Rescuers Say Israeli Fire Kills 20 Waiting For Aid
content: Gaza's civil defence agency said Israeli troops killed 20 people waiting to collect food, in the latest deadly incident near a US-backed aid centre in the Palestinian territory's south.

title: On Trump's No To Killing Iran's Supreme Leader, A Big Remark By Netanyahu
content: A day after US officials confirmed that Donald Trump had vetoed Israeli plans to assassinate Iran's Supreme Leader, Israeli PM Benjamin Netanyahu has reiterated that the quickest way to end this conflict is for Israel to take out the Ayatollah.

title: Noida Couple Fined Rs 55,000 After Video Of Bike Stunt Goes Viral
content: A video of a man and woman performing a dangerous stunt on a motorcycle along the Noida-Greater Noida Expressway surfaced on social media on Monday, prompting the local traffic police to issue a fine of Rs 55,000 for flouting traffic norms.

title: Huge Jams On Tehran Streets As Residents Flee Israeli Attacks: Reports
content: Residents of Tehran have fled the Iranian capital in large numbers in the face of Israeli bombardments, creating immense traffic jams on the main road heading north.

title: High-Level Panel Holds Review Meet To Discuss Air India Plane Crash
content: A high-level committee meeting was convened in Delhi today to review the circumstances surrounding the recent air crash tragedy.

title: Trump Family Lends Name To New Mobile Phone Venture
content: The Trump Organization announced it will launch a new mobile phone service, expanding the family's business empire while Donald Trump is president.
